posts.cooked:
Hello everyone!

It is past week 3 and I wanted to know for those of you who are using YAGSL or looking at using YAGSL (even in the offseason) how it looks, if there is anything that could make it better or easier?

If you have been using it what cool things have you done that may have been significantly easier with YAGSL than without?

For reference here are the official features and resources links:

Links Wiki Configurator Example Code Known working Configurations Javadocs Feature List + Explanation Community Sourced Debugging Steps Dependencies NavX library (https://pdocs.kauailabs.com/navx-m...

Updated nightly! ✔️ JSON The swerve drive main configuration is JSON based. The JSON guide is located on the main YAGSL wiki Easy installation NavX library (https://pdocs.kauailabs.com/navx-mxp/sof...

link_counts.title: Yet Another Generic Swerve Library (YAGSL) Beta
What's the best library/sources that I can learn from about Swerve Drive?

posts.cooked: I can’t wait until I completely support advantage scope. I theoretically support advantagescope swerve drive visualizer but haven’t tested it.

posts.name: Adan Silva
posts.cooked:
YAGSL was great for us, as we were able to swap between proto and comp bot swerve values without having to change up a lot of code. It helped us get PathPlanner working with it relatively early on and create a great balance auton at Ventura, which we hope to replicate with a 2 piece at Lancaster. Thanks again @nstrike for the work and as always, we are able to contribute where-ever we can!

We are now looking into implementing a drive to pose featuring using pose estimation, which is easier now thanks to the additional features the SwerveController has, so can’t wait for that.

BTW: AdvantageScope supports NT4, so AdvantageKit isn’t 100% percent necessary. However, if that’s your plan, that’s cool too! We use NT4 as it’s what we’re used to with special wrappers around it. Have to add those back in as I recently updated our local copy of the library.

Anyways, thanks again!

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: 3512A | Part-Time Software Help | Cal Poly SLO 27 |

posts.custom_user_title: 3512A | Part-Time Software Help | Cal Poly SLO 27 |

posts.cooked:
I do need to switch everything over to NT4 eventually, currently I am using SmartDashboard (NT3 I think?). I also would like to make the example project a little easier to understand. I saw some classes that wrap simple NT4 entries to objects and like that alot so i may replicate that and put it under the parser package.

Any changes you find useful for your team may be useful for others and I encourage you to upstream or let me know about them!

Same thing applies to formerly super-complex commands becoming extremely easy (like the auto balancer), I love showing those off in YAGSL-Example !

If you contain DriveToPose well enough it may make sense to add that to SwerveDrive too

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: I am having trouble with some code I believe in the Swerve module state and I am not for sure though because instead of changing motor direction what the code does is turn the wheel 180 degrees. Here is the code I am using https://github.com/7657thunderbots/7657SwerveYAGSLCode Here is a video https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vjoCEL-aqsqCsSsBW60BTg_v4tVDYaHJ/view?usp=sharing
Does it seem to be going the wrong direction when you try to strafe or is it always trying to turn 180 deg whenever you move the stick first?

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: It always turns 180 so if I were to press forward and then back it would then flip the direction same with left and right. It is like it doesn’t want to put the motors in reverse

Can you send a video of what is happening in frc-web-components? It could be an issue with your configuration or related to the fact i use rotation2d instead of storing angles as doubles, i plan on overloading rotation2d with my own so i can store direct angles and optimize correctly

Tauri app for FRC Web Components dashboard. Contribute to frc-web-components/app development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Jason Daming
posts.cooked:
nstrike:

i use rotation2d instead of storing angles as doubles, i plan on overloading rotation2d with my own so i can store direct angles and optimize correctly

Can you explain this?  I am not sure what you mean and something seems off.

posts.name: Tyler Veness
Landon
posts.cooked: I checked my swerve module state and what it was it needed to be set to 90 degrees instead of 180

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: It is fixed now thanks
That actually makes alot of sense now, thanks!
In SwerveModuleState2.optimize ? If that worked i should update YAGSL to ensure others don’t get this error, and I should remove 2nd order kinematics again while I am at it.

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: Yes Also is the closed field relative supposed to field relative driving where if you press forward it goes in the same direction no matter the angle?
Yes, one stick controls movement, the other controls orientation
Thank you for testing this! I just upstreamed and propagated it to all YAGSL repositories

posts.name: Landon
posts.cooked: Something is not right with closed field relative drive because it is not fully field oriented or robot oriented the big I found is if you turn while going fowards or backwards it changes the orientation of front If you turn while you are not moving forward the orientation stays the same

I think this issue is in the FAQ under here.

When you are tuning your absolute encoder offsets FACE THE BEVELS THE SAME WAY. If your odometry is always a bit off please check you wheel diameters, the grip tape might be worn and smaller than b...

Let me know if this works!
